intro: Hieracium talasilepis, commonly known as the Talasilepsis hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium talasilepis is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
